meanings.definition: To remove or expel from a position or place.
meanings.sent1: The principal decided to oust the troublemaker from the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The company board voted to oust the CEO due to misconduct.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to oust the rabbit from the hat, but it refused to budge.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to oust the leaves from the trees in a hurry.
meanings.sent5: The knight's sword was ready to oust the dragon from its lair.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise helped oust the intruder from the building.
meanings.sent2: The sneeze seemed to oust all the dust from the old bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to oust the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The sudden burst of laughter seemed to oust the tension from the room.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the flowers managed to oust all other scents from the garden.
